text:
The Centre on Sunday ordered a high-level probe into Saturday’s fire at IOCL’s refinery. It said the incident will not affect Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s visit to Paradip to dedicate the Rs. 35,000-project to the nation on February 7.

Union Petroleum Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said the Oil Industry Safety Directorate (OISD) has been asked to inquire into the fire incident that took place at the refinery’s Atmospheric Vaccum Unit (AVU) near gate number one and file report in three days.

Maintaining that the fire has been completely extinguished, Mr. Pradhan, who visited the site on Sunday, said the exact reason behind the incident could be ascertained only after getting a detailed report from the OISD.

No injury has been reported due to the fire, which caused minor damage to the outlet pumping section of AVU, he said.

The Minister said the incident will have no impact Mr. Modi’s visit. — PTI
title: Probe ordered into Paradip refinery fire
